attributes.action: Launch an Independent Tax Investigation into Politicians Expense claims
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A large proportion of the British people no longer trust the government to tell the truth.
The recent MP expense claim scandal is a typical example of the underhand way in which the politicians can...
A) Misuse tax payer’s money...
B) Make up rules for themselves that are not in the British public’s interest...
C) Hide the facts from the public to avoid being found out.
The public are outraged that the government act as though they are above the law to profit personally at the tax payer expense.
In order to restore some public support there must be a full, independent enquiry with any politicians found guilty of wrongdoing being dismissed for life and prosecuted as required by British law.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
